page.title: 19Changes at Aston Hall
page.content: Aston Hall was first used as the{manor {house back in the 14th}century.It has had many owners including Lords,Earls and an Archbishop.The grounds are marked by a ditch with a wall at the top of the ditch. Since 1948 the Hall was called {Aughton Court Hospital}and was used as a home for mentally ill ladies.It has fallen into a state of disrepair. The police used the Hall as a hostel during the{1984/85 miners' strike. On 23rd March 1985{Firth and Pilling, the chemists,bought the Hall and hope to turn it into a{private {convalescence home. There is a{preservation order}on the building which stops changes being made to the outside and parts of the inside but they are allowed to repair any damage.Mr Eades has been looking after the Hall and dealing with it.
